Voter fraud has been confirmed in several states, including Mississippi. Louisiana's top election official is warning residents about potential scams aimed at getting their personal information after similar problems in several other states. The scam involves the caller claiming to work for a voter registration organization. The callers offer to register residents over the phone, and in some cases, send the voter a mail-in ballot, said Secretary of State Kyle Ardoin. According to state law, residents cannot register to vote or request a mail-in ballot over the phone.

For small businesses that sell on credit, accounts receivable can make up a significant portion of the balance sheet. During the annual audit, auditors will verify that you can substantiate your accounts receivable balance claims. These claims are known as assertions. The most common audit procedure related to accounts receivable is confirmation, where the auditor will ask your customers to confirm their account balance. Knowing which assertions can be proven through confirmation can help you understand why your auditor requires several audit procedures for the same account. Accounts receivable confirmations are primarily used to prove the existence assertion.

It happens: you hit the snooze button once, twice, and then three times, so by the time you finally take a shower, get dressed, and are ready to tackle the day, you're already running behind schedule. Often, this causes you to skip breakfast altogether. It turns out that your breakfast habit is one of the time-saving steps that shouldn't be skipped. Firstly, consuming a nutritious, high-protein, and balanced breakfast every morning is a proven way to kick-start your brain, improving concentration and productivity. Additionally, breakfast is associated with better weight control, as it provides your body with energy and can reduce hunger later in the day.

Dublin: Lawmakers voted overwhelmingly on Friday to support Ireland's first abortion bill, legalizing the practice in exceptional cases where doctors deem a woman's life to be at risk due to her pregnancy, thus making the country's first legislative step away from a total ban with its predominantly Catholic population. Weary lawmakers applauded the Friday vote of 127-31, while outside the parliament gates, abortion rights activists cheered, watching the result on their smartphones. This marked the culmination of grueling debates that pitted lawmakers from Wednesday morning until 5 am Thursday and, after a sleep break, until midnight Friday.

VOLGOGRAD/GELENDZHIK, Russia (Reuters) - Iceland will try not to melt in the heat of Volgograd when they play Nigeria in their only second World Cup match on Friday after impressively drawing with twice champions Argentina over the weekend. World Cup debutants Iceland are dreaming of the knockout stage and writing a new chapter in one of the most remarkable stories in international football in recent years. Standing in their way is not only Nigeria, who desperately need a win after losing their first match to Croatia 2-0, but also the challenge of the heat in the southern Russian city.

Two thieves from Metro Vancouver have been arrested and charged after allegedly committing a long series of mail thefts and identity-related crimes. After the Royal Canadian Mounted Police from Coquitlam and Canada Post inspectors worked together on the investigation into mail theft, investigators identified the main suspect, made arrests, and used search warrants to seize a large amount of evidence, according to a November 11 press release from the Coquitlam Royal Canadian Mounted Police. Hai Ne Hat, a 49-year-old Surrey resident well known to police, is facing six charges, including mail theft, unauthorized use of a postal key, as well as possession of stolen mail and a stolen credit card.

First, we looked at which major brands are the most expensive to maintain over the first 10 years of a vehicle's life. We grouped all model years by brand to calculate the average cost by brand. To estimate annual maintenance costs, we identified the amount spent on every other oil change (since oil changes are typically done every six months). German imports, perhaps not surprisingly, top the list by a wide margin. Toyota and its two brands, Lexus and Scion, are among the cheapest, saving owners at least $10,000 over ten years compared to BMW.

AURORA, Ill. – A suburban teenager died after a tragic accident in a school parking lot. Police report that 17-year-old Steven Woodcock of St. Charles died Monday morning, May 16, 2016, after suffering injuries on Friday afternoon in the parking lot of Marmion Academy. According to police, the teen was riding in the passenger seat of an SUV in the parking lot when he lost his grip, according to WGN. He fell backward and hit his head on the asphalt. Police report that Woodcock suffered head injuries and other damage. He was given aid at the scene and then taken to the hospital by helicopter on Monday.

Veteran Congressman Jim Leach (R-Iowa) was defeated in the 2006 bloodbath. I am not a defender of "moderate Republicans," but it's worth saying that Leach, in my opinion, was obviously the best Republican in the House. Nevertheless, one can only rejoice at his defeat. The fact that it happened only shows how fundamentally rotten the entire Republican party apparatus has become. Leach was, in many ways, a man with genuinely decent instincts and some fundamentally correct ideas about how the US should conduct itself in the world. Nevertheless, in practice, he was useless.

Donald Trump's tweets have long raised questions about whether they violate Twitter's rules prohibiting abusive behavior on the service. On Monday, after a Trump tweet threatened that North Korea "won't be around much longer", Twitter was forced to explain why the president wasn't blocked from the service. In a six-tweet statement from Twitter's public policy account, the company said that Twitter takes into account "newsworthiness" and "public interest" when determining whether a user has violated its rules. These factors have long been used internally by the company when deciding the fate of a problematic user, Twitter said.

After the first two months of the year went largely according to plan, Summit County real estate sales experienced a slump in March, leading to a notable downturn in first-quarter numbers, according to data from Slifer Smith & Frampton. The High Country real estate giant tracks a wide range of statistics related to the local real estate market, and Summit County saw a decline of around 12 percent in both the number of real estate transactions and their total value during the first three months of 2018 compared to the first quarter of 2017, according to the company's latest market report.

Casey Brambello, a Stanhope Elmore High School student, was selected to serve on the State Department of Education's Superintendent's Student Advisory Council. Casey is one of 16 high school students chosen from 80 applicants. The panel of judges reviewing student applications included representatives from ALSDE, CLAS, AASB, A+ Education Partnership, and Alabama's 2015-2016 Teacher of the Year. Defensive coordinator Clark Lea said that fifth-year linebacker Asmar Bilal is currently the closest to being "absolute" in the unit, but he seems to agree with the uncertainty. It's hard to overstate Amazon's success and growing power. Their market capitalization is hovering just below $1 trillion. Their growth rates have been stunning. By most estimates, Amazon now accounts for nearly 50% of all US e-commerce sales, about 5% of all retail sales, and significantly more than their next 10 competitors combined. One study shows that about 55% of all online product searches start on Amazon. This week's report that Amazon is considering opening as many as 3,000 of its cashierless Amazon Go stores by 2021 drew a lot of attention, despite having opened only its fourth location just a few days ago.

Seeing myself on the internet, I opened my eyes — the way I expressed myself is inexcusable and is not the person I am. I see that my words and actions hurt people, and for that, I deeply regret it. It is not uncommon for us to read and hear complaints about the amount of waste used by the two main parties, a phenomenon that seems to intensify during election campaigns. And yet, rarely do these two parties actively strive for genuine waste. And by that, I mean a discussion about waste in the literal sense! The city of Zamboanga - Horror has gripped the residents of Pata Island in Sulu, and it does not come from extremists, but from politicians. The residents have sought help from the government to prevent another attack on their island community, which, according to one of them, was provoked by the residents' refusal to support the incumbent mayor, Anton Buruhan. "We are helpless," said 60-year-old Bidin Jubail, a resident of Saimbangan, one of the villages on Pata Island. Jubail recalled the attack on the island city, allegedly committed by Buruhan's followers on January 2, who were armed with an M203 grenade launcher and M-14 and M-16 rifles.

German business optimism has slumped to its lowest level in more than 2.5 years in October, a sixth consecutive decline dispelling any remaining doubts that Europe's largest economy is now mired in the euro zone debt crisis. The Munich-based Ifo research center said on Wednesday that its business climate index, based on a monthly survey of around 7,000 companies, fell to 100.0 in October from 101.4 in September. "The clouds over the German economy are darkening," Ifo President Hans-Werner Sinn said. The euro fell to a one-week low against the dollar, and European stocks turned negative after the Ifo data was released.

LOS ANGELES – An attempt to grant subpoena power to the commission overseeing the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department will go to a vote in March 2020, after failing to gain approval from the Board of Supervisors today. Proponents of the "Los Angeles County Jail Reform" initiative gathered nearly a quarter million signatures in support of the measure, which would also give the Civilian Oversight Commission a mandate to explore reducing the number of inmates in county jails and redirecting funds from jail construction to alternative sentencing measures. Supervisor Sheila Kuehl stated that more of the county's 10 million residents should be allowed to weigh in on the matter.

The Herts Baseball Club has been awarded a £10,000 grant from Sport England to open a satellite club in North West London and provide the local community with the opportunity to play baseball. The Herts Baseball Club is based at Grovehill Ballpark in Hemel Hempstead since its inception in 1996. It has grown into one of the largest baseball clubs in the UK, with eight teams competing in various adult and youth leagues of the British Baseball Federation. Ottawa, March 20 (Reuters) - In the latest blow to the government of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, a lawmaker quit the ruling Liberal Party to sit as an independent on Wednesday after defending a former minister at the center of a political scandal. Trudeau has been on the defensive since February 7 over allegations that top officials working for him pressured former Justice Minister Jody Wilson-Raybould to ensure that construction company SNC-Lavalin Group Inc avoided a trial on corruption charges. The political crisis threatens the government's chances of re-election in a vote scheduled for October this year.

The Supreme Court on Friday asked the National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI) in Nagpur and the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) to consider the Agra Municipal Corporation's proposal to set up a waste-to-energy plant. Agra falls in the Taj Trapezium Zone, which spans around 10,400 square kilometers and includes the districts of Firozabad, Mathura, Hathras, and Etah in Uttar Pradesh, and Bharatpur district in Rajasthan. The Agra Municipal Corporation, the local governing body of the city, had approached the top court seeking permission to construct the waste-to-energy plant at the Kuberpur dumpsite.

If the Old Fish House could talk, just imagine the fascinating stories it would tell about 100 years of life by the Indian River Lagoon. It could tell us about the early days when entire families slept on their fishing boats. Washington, July 31, 2018 / 15:01. - The Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority (WMATA) had the right to ban religious advertising by the Archdiocese of Washington, the US Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit ruled on Tuesday. In November 2015, WMATA published 14 new guidelines for acceptable advertising on buses and trains. Guideline 12 explicitly prohibited "advertisements that promote or oppose any religion, religious practice or belief." These new guidelines emerged after someone tried to purchase an ad featuring an image of Muhammad.

The jazz ensemble, under the direction of Director Christopher Dorsey, took first place this year at the "Essentially Ellington" High School Jazz Band Competition and Festival in New York, the most prestigious high school jazz competition in the country. Maureen Wildes claims it's time to learn about the true impact of the Vietnam War on the children of veterans. Like many other children of veterans, I am also a statistic. If this research had been conducted many years ago, when it should have been conducted, perhaps I would have understood what was happening to me, not to mention my father. Albany - Governor Andrew Cuomo, who has two Twitter accounts with more than 863,000 followers, called the popular social media site an "elitist bulletin board" on Tuesday and said he doesn't look at it. Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif met with Prime Minister Imran Khan on Friday at the Prime Minister's residence, where both sides emphasized the need to develop bilateral relations in all areas of cooperation. According to Premier Khan, Pakistan and Iran are key to growth and prosperity in the region through strengthening links and developing people-to-people contacts, as reported by Radio Pakistan. The Prime Minister thanked the Supreme Leader of Iran for supporting the Kashmiris' struggle for self-determination. Zarif conveyed a message from Iranian President Hassan Rouhani, inviting the Prime Minister to the upcoming Asian Cooperation Summit to be held in Iran in October this year.

Without a doubt, the addiction drama "Beautiful Boy" - not the horror film "Halloween" - is the most disturbing movie opening this weekend. Starring Steve Carell ("Foxcatcher") and Timothée Chalamet ("Call Me By Your Name"), the film is a haunting and harrowing look at a young man's descent into methamphetamine addiction (and heroin, pills, marijuana, etc.) and the efforts of a devoted father trying to save him. It's a true and terrifying story, so powerful that even an uninspired director and clichéd script can't diminish its impact.

Shiv Sena party's executive president Uddhav Thackeray has called upon India's agriculture minister and Nationalist Congress Party leader Sharad Pawar to resign from the cabinet and come to Maharashtra to protect the interests of drought-affected farmers. After visiting the house of farmer Gajanan Gotekar, who recently committed suicide and blamed the Congress and NCP for the plight of farmers in his suicide note, Thackeray told journalists yesterday that he has appealed to farmers not to vote for the NCP and Congress. Uddhav met the relatives of the deceased and, although he did not provide any immediate financial assistance, he promised to take on the educational expenses of his children.

Several recent studies have shown that patients with dementia greatly benefit from participating in art therapy. Every person has a busy life, but if you have recently moved a loved one into a nursing home or memory cottage, it is even more important to stay in touch with them. WASHINGTON -- An Iowa egg producer at the center of a national salmonella outbreak apologized to the congressional committee on Wednesday and acknowledged that his family business "grew too big too fast." The incline press is a strength training exercise that targets the chest and the front deltoids. Incline chest press machines, which mimic the movement in a fixed plane, are another way to perform the exercise. The incline press is one of several exercises that help create symmetry and strength in the muscles of the upper body.

The unemployment rate in Stark County dropped to 6.8 percent in August, the lowest since September 2008. For the first time since 2008, the unemployment rate in Stark County has dipped below 7 percent, and it's likely that multiple factors contributed to the decline. The main suspect is the influx of businesses to the area due to the Utica Shale oil and natural gas drilling. Oil exploration companies moved into the area, followed by engineering and construction firms providing various services. Manufacturing has also experienced a boost due to increased local and national demand for steel and drilling equipment.

Summary: Southeast Toyota Distributors (SET) is recalling certain model year 2016 Toyota Yaris, Rav4, Land Cruiser, and 4Runner, as well as Scion FR-S, iM, and TC vehicles manufactured from January 28, 2016, to March 14, 2016. An American Civil Liberties Union attorney asked a federal appeals court in San Francisco to block a California law that requires police to collect a DNA sample from anyone arrested on suspicion of a serious crime. The law is part of a 2004 voter initiative that gradually expanded the categories of people in the criminal justice system from whom DNA is collected through a cheek swab. Four plaintiffs are challenging the provision, which took effect in 2009 and requires DNA collection from everyone arrested on suspicion of a serious crime, regardless of whether they are charged or convicted of a crime.

LOS ANGELES (AP) - Kings forward Anze Kopitar will undergo surgery on Wednesday to repair a torn ligament in his severely sprained right ankle. An MRI exam on Monday confirmed that the Kings' top scorer will require corrective surgery that will keep him out of the lineup for an undetermined period. Kopitar injured the ankle when he fell awkwardly during the Kings' win over Colorado on Saturday. Coach Terry Murray initially said the Slovenian all-star had broken his ankle and would be out at least six weeks, but the Kings ultimately determined the injury was a severe ankle sprain. Kopitar leads the Kings with 25 goals and 43 assists.

Richard Randolph Lamb, a resident of Dunsmuir, passed away on September 17, 2009, at Mercy Medical Center in Mount Shasta. Richard was born in Fairview, Montana. He moved to Siskiyou County from Oregon in 1919. Richard was a U.S. Navy veteran, serving in the Pacific Fleet during World War II. He worked as a locomotive engineer for the Southern Pacific Railroad for 34 years. Richard was a member of the Veterans of Foreign Wars in Dunsmuir. The Korean Shipbuilders' Association and the Shipyard Association released figures that confirm the expectations of many analysts: the number of active shipyards worldwide has decreased by more than 40 percent compared to what it was seven years ago. In the study, an active shipyard was understood to be a facility that had at least one ship in its order book. The number of active shipyards in China decreased from 380 to 140, and in Japan from 70 to 60 during the same period, the association reported. Additionally, the world's largest shipyards - DSME, Hyundai Heavy, and Samsung Heavy - may face empty yards and unused capacity as early as next year.

According to data provided by Datacenter Dynamics, over the past two years, the Russian data center market has outpaced India, China, and Brazil in terms of total investment. Similarly, based on recent construction data for the same period, Russia ranks second after Brazil among the BRICS countries in terms of total area.

GENEVA – The head of the United Nations fact-finding mission on the Gaza conflict, Judge Richard Goldstone, today called on the international community to put an end to impunity for violations of international law in Israel and the occupied Palestinian territory, as he presented the mission's report* to the Human Rights Council. After a three-month investigation, the four-member mission concluded that serious violations of international law by Israel had been committed in the context of its military operations in Gaza from 27 December 2008 to 18 January 2009, and that Israel had committed actions that could be qualified as war crimes, and possibly crimes against humanity.
